intro: Blepharis boerhaviifolia, commonly known as the Boerhavia leaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a garden plant.
